prompt.role: You are an expert in clinical hepatology with experience in medical assessment using Script Concordance Tests (SCT). Your task is to generate a complete SCT item following best practices in instructional design and clinical reasoning.

sct_context.description: The SCT is an assessment tool that measures clinical reasoning in situations of uncertainty.

structure.item: A clinical vignette with controlled ambiguity
New information that modulates that hypothesis
A 5-point Likert scale to assess the probability change

field.name: domain
field.description: Single clinical category for the item (subdomain)
field.requirement: Ensures balanced coverage of the curriculum
field.rule: ONLY ONE subdomain per item (do not mix)

field.name: vignette
field.lab_values: Plausible values (AST/ALT, INR, bilirubin, platelets, ALP, GGT, MELD)

field.name: hypothesis
field.length_requirement: Must be 8-25 words in length (count carefully!)

examples.example: The clinical picture is consistent with spontaneous bacterial peritonitis requiring immediate antibiotic therapy
Ordering magnetic resonance cholangiopancreatography is useful at this point in the diagnostic workup

field.tip: If your hypothesis is too short, add relevant clinical context or specificity

field.name: new_information
field.description: Additional data that modulates the hypothesis (result, imaging, evolution)
field.requirement: Relevant, NOT redundant with the vignette
field.goldilocks_zone: NOT deterministic ("Goldilocks zone": moves the needle but not obvious)

field.name: question
field.required_text: How does the probability of the hypothesis change?

field.name: author_notes
field.description: Brief internal note (NOT shown to panel)
field.content: Clinical rationale + expected effect in 1-3 sentences
field.tip: Keep it concise: avoid conjunctions that create multiple clauses
field.example: PMN ≥250 supports SBP and should shift towards +2/+1. Some experts might mark +1 if considering alternative diagnoses.

antipatterns.pattern: Double or ambiguous hypothesis ("SBP or cholangitis")
Hypothesis too short (<8 words) or too long (>25 words)

task.instruction: Generate a complete SCT item in English about hepatology that meets ALL the above criteria.
task.output_format: Generate the complete SCT item following the structured JSON format with all required fields.

critical_validation.title: CRITICAL VALIDATION REQUIREMENTS (must pass all checks)
critical_validation.requirement: Author notes: Maximum 3 sentences (count periods carefully)
critical_validation.final_instruction: Double-check word counts and sentence counts before generating the final output.
